action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes two attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage.

action.name: Sharpshot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 600/600 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 1d8 + 14}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Archer's Eye (3/Day)
entries: Immediately after making an attack roll or a damage roll with a ranged weapon, the archer can roll a {@dice d10} and add the number rolled to the total.

fluff.name: Archer
entries: Archers defend castles, hunt wild game on the fringes of civilization, serve as artillery in military units, and occasionally make good coin as brigands or caravan guards.

Some renowned archers and groups of archers are known for the special fletching of their arrows. You may roll on the Archer Fletching table to determine the distinctive fletching used by an individual archer or a group of them.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast [2 Beams]
entries: {@atk rsp} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

bonus.name: Shove
entries: {@hit 7}  contested by opposing Athletics or Acrobatics or they fall {@condition prone}

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Knights are warriors who pledge service to rulers, religious orders, and noble causes. A knight's alignment determines the extent to which a pledge is honored. Whether undertaking a quest or patrolling a realm, a knight often travels with an entourage that includes squires and hirelings who are commoners.

vulnerable.special: The mob is vulnerable to area effect attacks and to attacks which affect more than one target.

trait.name: Mob Nature.
entries: The mob can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the mob can move through any opening large enough for a the base creature. The mob can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. Additionally, the mob automatically fails checks made against area-affect attacks.

action.name: Fighting Back
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., any target in range. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.
Commoners include peasants, serfs, slaves, servants, pilgrims, merchants, artisans, and hermits.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bandit is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The bandit has the following spells prepared

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rsp} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

bonus.name: Off Hand Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke
entries: Cast Hellish Rebuke when taking damage the first time.

Bandits rove in gangs and are sometimes led by thugs, veterans, or spellcasters. Not all bandits are evil. Oppression, drought, disease, or famine can often drive otherwise honest folk to a life of banditry.

Pirates are bandits of the high seas. They might be freebooters interested only in treasure and murder, or they might be privateers sanctioned by the crown to attack and plunder an enemy nation's vessels.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Blood Lord's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Blood Lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the Blood Lord is wearing no armor and not wielding a {@item shield|PHB}, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Blood Lord makes four attacks with its Dual Bloodswords or three attacks with its Crimson Spear.

action.name: Dual Bloodswords
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Crimson Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage if used with both hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Whirlwind Strikes {@recharge 5}
entries: Each Creature within 15 feet of the Blood Lord must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity Save or take ({@damage 5d6}) slashing and ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage, half as much on a success

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: The Blood Lord can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Blood  Lord makes a Crimson spear or Dual Bloodswords attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Blood Lord moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Blood Lord {@action cast a spell|PHB|casts an innate spell}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spells
entries: {@atk sp} {@hit 4} to hit or {@dc 12}, varied range ({@damage 1d8}) ({@damage 1d12}) ({@damage 3d10}) ({@damage 4d10})
Fanatics are often part of a cult's leadership, using their charisma and dogma to influence and prey on those of weak will. Most are interested in personal power above all else

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: All allies within 10 feet gain +3 to saves.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Lieutenant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight attacks twice with one of its weapons.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing and ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast [2 Beams]
entries: {@atk rsp} {@hit 6} to hit, 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

Bone knights are the champions of the Order of the Emerald Claw. Clad in distinctive bonecraft armor—heavy armor adorned with the bones of fallen enemies—these fearsome warriors command squads of undead soldiers as they pursue the sinister goals of Lady Illmarrow.

entries.name: Karrnathi Patriots
entries: Early in the Last War, Karrnath turned to the necromancers of the Blood of Vol to bolster the nation's army with undead forces. The skeletons and zombies created by the necromancers were mindless creatures that required guidance. The first bone knights were appointed to provide this control.

Devoted paladins of the Blood of Vol were fused into suits of bonecraft armor, whose magic focused their divine gifts, allowing them to command units of mindless undead. Bonecraft armor can't be removed without killing the knight who wears it, and when donning it, each bone knight understood that their former life was over.

entries.name: The Fall of the Emerald Claw
entries: During the Last War, many bone knights took service with the Order of the Emerald Claw, helping that name strike fear into the enemies of Karrnath. In the last decade, King Kaius III of Karrnath has done much to ensure a peaceful end to the Last War. Under the terms of the Treaty of Thronehold, Kaius sealed most of Karrnath's undead in deep vaults, and the Order of the Emerald Claw was disbanded. A few bone knights remained in service to the crown, but most were cast aside—still bound to their bonecraft armor and still convinced of Karrnathi supremacy. These bone knights felt that Kaius had betrayed both them and their nation, leading their once-proud order to find a new purpose in the service of Lady Illmarrow.

legendary.name: Greatsword
entries: Makes an attack with the Greatsword

legendary.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: Cast Eldritch Blast

legendary.name: Cast Spell (2 Actions)
entries: uses it's Spellcasting feature

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Shadowtooth is an 19th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Shadowtooth Black fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: Shadowtooth has advantage on Constitution saving throws that he makes to maintain your concentration on a spell when he takes damage.

action.name: Cast Spell
entries: Cast a Spell [See Spell List]

action.name: as Giant Ape [CR 6 Form]
entries: 2 Fists or 1 Rock
Fist. {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
Rock. {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: as T-Rex [CR 6 Form]
entries: Bite and Tail, separate targets

Bite. {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.
Tail.  {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Combat Wild Shape 2/Short Rest
entries: When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you gain the ability to use Wild Shape on your turn as a bonus action, rather than as an action.

bonus.name: Beast Healing
entries: While Shadowtooth is transformed by Wild Shape, he can use a bonus action to expend one spell slot to regain {@dice 1d8} hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a hostile creature’s movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

reaction.name: Fire Damage Absorption. 1/Long Rest
entries: When you take fire damage, you can use your reaction to gain immunity against the fire damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. Once this reaction is used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn.

reaction.name: Radiant Damage Absorption. 1/Long Rest
entries: When you take radiant damage, you can use your reaction to gain immunity against the radiant damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. Once this reaction is used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn.

legendary.name: Spellcasting [1-3 Action]
entries: Cast a Spell of;
Cantrip - 1 Action
1st - 3rd - 2 Actions
4th - 6th - 3 Actions

legendary.name: Move [1 Action]
entries: Move up to his movement speed.

legendary.name: Wild Shape Attack [1 Action]
entries: Uses a Wild Shape Attack

legendary.name: Wild Shape [1 Action]
entries: Use a Wild Shape

monster.name: Bavlorna Matroska

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance 2/Day
entries: If Bavlorna fails a saving throw she can choose to succeed instead

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag makes two Nightmare Touch attacks.

action.name: Nightmare Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is {@condition unconscious}, it takes an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Dream Eater
entries: When an {@condition unconscious} creature the hag can see within 30 feet of her regains consciousness, the hag can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage, and the hag regains hit points equal to the amount of damage taken.

legendary.name: Etheral Step
entries: Move to a space within 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Nightmare Touch
entries: uses a Nightmare Touch attack

legendary.name: Mind Sliver [2 Actions]
entries: casts Mind Sliver

legendaryHeader: Bavlorna can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Bavlorna regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

monster.name: Putrid Piper

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the bard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Supreme Focus
entries: The bard has advantage on saving throws it makes to maintain its concentration.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Rat Command 3/Day
entries: The Piper plays a tune on his flute commanding 2 rat swarms to appear around targets of their choice within 30 feet and attack

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard casts one of the following spells using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

legendary.name: Move
entries: The bard moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Vicious Mockery
entries: The bard casts {@spell vicious mockery}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The bard makes a melee or ranged attack.

legendary.name: Rat Command [2 Actions]
entries: The Piper plays a tune on his flute commanding 2 rat swarms to appear around targets of their choice within 30 feet and attack

legendaryHeader: The Piper can use 2 Legendary actions at the end of another creatures turn.

monster.name: Kavosen's Chosen

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
entries: When the Chosen One fails a save it can succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chosen makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) b/p/s damage.

action.name: Rock {@recharge 5}
entries: {@dc 15} DEX Save in 5 ft radius ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, half on success

legendary.name: Attack [1 Action]
entries: Attack with the weapon

legendary.name: Combat Dash [1 Action]
entries: Moves up to his movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

mythic.name: Reinforcments
entries: Summon 4 Mascots, act on init 20

mythic.name: Earthquake
entries: {@dc 15} DEX Save or creatures in lair fall {@condition prone}

mythicHeader: At Initiative 20 the Lair does an action, can't use the same 2 actions at once

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage in melee, or 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) radiant damage at range.

bonus.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Flurry of Blows 2x [1 Ki]
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage in melee, or 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) radiant damage at range.

bonus.name: Monk Shit [1 Ki]
entries: take the Hide, Disengage, Dash, or Dodge action

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.
Additionally, when you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.

trait.name: Crusher [1/Turn]
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: When the Stabber hits with a melee attack, it can attack again and continue making additional attacks until it misses. The stabby-stabber cannot move between the attacks made with this trait.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The Stabber can use the {@action Disengage}, {@action Dash}, or {@action Hide} action.

bonus.name: Insightful Fighting
entries: As a bonus action, you make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn’t {@condition incapacitated}, contested by the target’s Charisma (Deception) check. If you succeed, you can use your Sneak Attack against that target even if you don't have advantage on the attack roll, but not if you have disadvantage on it.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide Action.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if Sneak Attack is available.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can halve the attack’s damage against you.

monster.name: Warlock of the Ravager, Legendary

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the warlock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
entries: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

trait.name: Spell Penetration
entries: When the warlock casts a spell and is interrupted by an enemy's {@spell counterspell}, treat the spell's level as 3 levels higher.

trait.name: Supreme Focus
entries: The warlock has advantage on saving throws it makes to maintain its concentration.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Summon Blood Lord (1/Day)
entries: The warlock summons a Blood Lord. It appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the warlock and acts as an ally of the warlock. It remains for an hour, until it or the warlock dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock casts one of the following spells using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks):

legendary.name: Move
entries: The warlock moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Quarterstaff
entries: The warlock attacks with its Quarterstaff.

legendary.name: Diabolical Presence
entries: The warlock targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the warlock, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} (warlock's choice) for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to warlock's Diabolical Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Eldritch Blast (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The warlock casts {@spell eldritch blast}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Christhia can make two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.
If smiting add ({@damage 2d8}) ({@damage 3d8}) ({@damage 4d8}) ({@damage 5d8})radiant damage.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don’t provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wendigo's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The wendigo can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the wendigo moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wendigo has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wendigo regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wendigo takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wendigo's next turn. The wendigo dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Wendigo fails a save it can choose to succeed instead

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wendigo makes three melee attacks: one with its ravenous bite or gore and two with its claws.

action.name: Ravenous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. While {@condition poisoned}, the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} at the start of each of its turns. This reduction will not cause a target's score to go below 3. When a target's Wisdom reaches a score of 3, it becomes insane and ravenous. While in this state, the creature acts as an ally of the wendigo, gains a bite attack ({@damage 1d6} piercing damage), and must spend its action each turn making a bite attack against an enemy of the wendigo. The Wisdom score reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Baleful Howl
entries: The wendigo emits a terrifying howl. Every enemy within 300 feet of the wendigo that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target that  starts its turn within 30 feet of the wendigo must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the wendigo as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A target that successfully saves is immune to the wendigo's baleful howl for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Uses its claw attack twice against the same target.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Uses its bite attack

legendary.name: Nimble Movement
entries: Moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks

legendary.name: Charge (2 Actions)
entries: Moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes a gore attack.

bonus.name: Maddening Whispers
entries: As a bonus action, the wendigo chooses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the wendigo's choice that the wendigo can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

item.name: Cloak of Cleanliness
entries: While wearing this cloak, you are always pristinely clean and well kept, along with having a slight scent of lavender.

item.name: Infinite Grimoire
entries: Your spell book now has an infinite number of pages, is three inches thick, eight inches wide, twelve inches long, and weighs three pounds.

You can use the grimoire as your spellbook, and you can scribe new spells into it as normal. When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire, the number of wizard spells you can prepare increases by 1.
In the presence of Wizards that show great power, those Wizards may see the grimoire show increased abilities over time.

entries.name: Enhanced
entries: rare (requires attunement by a wizard)
You gain a +1 to your Wizard Spell {@action Attack} rolls and Spell Save DC.
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 1 additional level of spells.

entries.name: Empowered
entries: very rare (requires attunement by a wizard)
You gain a +1 to your Wizard Spell {@action Attack} rolls and Spell Save DC.
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 2 additional level of spells.
When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire as your spellbook, the number of spells you can prepare increases by 2 total.

entries.name: Perfected
entries: legendary (requires attunement by a wizard)
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 3 additional level of spells.
When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire as your spellbook, the number of spells you can prepare increases by 3 total.
If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
You gain a +2 to your Wizard Spell {@action Attack} rolls and Spell Save DC.

item.name: Thunder of the Mammoth
entries: When blowing into this horn one creature of your choice can hear a Mammoth bellow, provided the creature is within 600 feet of the horn and not {@condition deafened}. No other creature hears sound coming from the horn.
As an Action you can use the command phrase and blow the horn to create a booming sound and cast the spell Shatter from it [DC13 CON]. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Life Stealing
entries: While wearing this amulet you can use an action to make an unarmed strike using STR or DEX to make the attack roll dealing {@dice 1d4} slashing{@damage  + 4d4} necrotic damage on a hit. Any necrotic damage is transferred to you as healing. Once used this property can't be used again until Midnight.
\columnbreak

item.name: Bracers of the War Mage
item.reqAttune: by a warlock, wizard, or sorcerer
entries: These bracers are made of hardened Dwarven Steel and are imbued with strong defensive magic, to protect the Dwarven War Mages in battle. While wearing these bracers your AC is 14 + DEX.

entries.name: Merchants Luck
entries: When worn (no attunement) the wearer gains advantage on the first persuasion check made every day used in relation to a trade (sale, purchase or barter).

entries.name: Tricksters Pain
entries: When worn (and attuned) the wearer cannot be deceived without being aware of the attempted deceit. The wearer cannot read minds but will immediately know when someone is not being completely truthful and have insight into the degree/scope of the subterfuge in question

entries.name: Spirit Bound
entries: When worn (and attuned) the wearers spirit/soul is bound to the diamond and becomes absorbed by the diamond upon death. When absorbed the spirit remains in the diamond until released. The soul is released when the necklace is worn by another creature and the soul determines that the creature is a suitable host and the soul will then take over the host body and imbue it with all its powers, traits and skills.

item.name: Dwarven Maul of Thunder
entries: This hand sized maul is made of Dwarven Steel inscribed with thunder runes, it hums with a light buzz. It is a martial melee weapon with the light and thrown properties and a range of 30/60. The damage die is {@dice d6}+STR and the type is thunder, after a throw the hammer returns to the thrower's hand.

Once per day on your turn you can speak the command phrase (BY ODINS BEARD) and throw the hammer a a target or unoccupied space, if at a target make an attack roll, any creature within 20 feet of the impact must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} lightning and {@dice 4d6} thunder as lightning strikes the area and the hammer crashes with a thunderclap. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the hammer can still be used as a magic weapon.
\pagebreakNum

item.name: Psionic Amplifier
entries: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you are attuned to this item. It has no Effect if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.
It also grants you telepathy (120ft) and glows with a purplish inner light (15 bright/15 dim) while you are attuned to it.
See the introduction of the Monster Manual for rules on how this telepathy works.

entries.name: Winds of Truth
entries: These matching armbands appear to have thin daggers strapped to them. As an action, you can pull up to two magic +1 daggers from the bracers and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack as the dagger seeks out a target that you can see within 120 feet of you ignoring half and three-quarters cover. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

item.name: Wand of Winter Storms
entries: This wand has 7 charges and is made of translucent crystal resembling a slender icicle. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell ice storm} spell (save DC 17) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 4th-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand melts into water and is destroyed.

entries.name: Swiftness of Sand
entries: The wielder of this Heka, as an action speaks the command phrase "I hate sand. Its coarse, and rough, and irritating. And it gets everywhere." and is magically transformed into a whirlwind of sand, moving up to 60 feet, and reverting to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the wielder is immune to all damage, and it can't be {@condition grappled}, {@condition petrified}, knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned}. Equipment worn or carried by the wielder remain in its possession. Once used in such a way it is unable to be used until the next dawn.

item.name: The Devil's Due
entries: This arrow has a icy blue shaft adorned with chardalyn razor fletching and matching head.

entries.name: Levistus' Ire
entries: This arrow adds a {@dice d6} of cold damage along with giving an additional +1 to attack and damage rolls when used to make a ranged attack, returning upon reaching or missing its target. Hitting a target with this arrow makes your next shot against that target have advantage. Upon a critical hit the target is wounded and loses 10 feet of movement speed and 5 feet for each after the first.
\columnbreak

item.name: Amulet of Lathander
entries: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this holy symbol. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Sword of the Elements
entries: This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} or {@item longsword|phb|longswords}, you are proficient with this sword.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals force damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an elemental with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage.

item.name: Spelljamming Mythallar
entries: The Spelljamming Mythallar looks like an large crystal ball filled with a swirling miasma resembling Wildspace held in an ornate cradle. The globe draws magic directly from the Weave that can be harnessed for various purposes. The Spelljamming Mythallar is capable of venturing into the multiverse.

The Spelljamming Mythallar is 10 feet in diameter, but controls the area within 500 feet of it. To attune to this mythallar, a creature must finish a short rest within 30 feet of it, meditating on the mythallar, this artifact does not count against your attunement limit. The Spelljamming Mythallar's properties are as follows:

items: While you're within 500 feet of the Spelljamming Mythallar, you can choose which direction and how fast the mythallar moves.  It can move up to Spelljamming Speed (100 million miles in 24 hours) in Wildspace or the Astral Sea, or up to 10 mph while objects weighing 1 ton or more are within 1 mile of it. All matter within 500 feet of the device moves with it. The Spelljamming Mythallar and all structures held aloft by it hover in place when not in motion.

As an action, you can cause one magic item you are holding within 30 feet of the Spelljamming Mythallar to immediately regain all its expended charges or uses. A magic item recharged in this manner can't be recharged by the Spelljamming Mythallar again until after the item regains expended charges or uses on its own.

You can use the Spelljamming Mythallar to cast the {@spell dream of the blue veil|tce} provided you have the material components. The creature limit is lifted and instead uses the area controlled by the mythallar. This property can be used 1 time per day, or after the mythallar has been fueled by a magic item (up to DM Discretion).

Any creature that touches the globe of the mythallar must make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 30d10 + 100} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any object that touches the globe, other than some artifacts or the mythallar's cradle, is disintegrated instantly (no save).

entries.name: Transfer Attunement
entries: You can use an action to touch a willing spellcaster. That creature attunes to the spelljamming helm immediately, and your attunement to it ends.

item.name: Belt of Utility
entries: This canvas belt is adorned with many small pouches along the strap, it is able to magically fit any waist and can only be unbuckled by the attuned wearer. When the attuned wearer reaches into a pouch of this belt they are able to pull any Adventuring Gear of their choice worth less than 10gp as their item interaction. The item persists until the belt is used again or the item is not in use, then the item produced disappears.

item.name: Belt of Giant Might
entries: While attuned to this belt, your Strength score changes to 19. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 19.

You can channel the Ancient Giant's essence as a Bonus Action to gain the benefits of the Enlarge portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 minute. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
